title: New Batch of Classified Documents Appear on Social Media Sites
description: Secret documents that appear to detail American national security secrets on Ukraine, the Middle East and China have surfaced online.

title: Russia Formally Charges Detained WSJ Journalist Evan Gershkovich, State Media Reports
description: Evan Gershkovich, a reporter for The Wall Street Journal, was detained last week. The Journal and U.S. officials have vehemently rejected the Russian authorities’ allegations against him.

title: Russia Formally Charges Detained WSJ Journalist Evan Gershkovich, State Media Reports
description: Evan Gershkovich, a reporter for The Wall Street Journal, was detained last week. The Journal and U.S. officials have vehemently rejected the Russian authorities’ allegations against him.

title: Macron Wraps Up China Visit, but Little Progress Seen on War
description: Russia’s war in Ukraine figured little in statements after meetings between President Emmanuel Macron of France and China’s leader, Xi Jinping.

title: Taliban Bar Women From U.N., Threatening Afghanistan’s Last Lifeline
description: The Taliban administration extended a ban on women working in aid organizations to the United Nations, putting at risk one of the country’s last sources of badly needed aid.

title: Custody of a Russian Girl Who Drew an Antiwar Picture Is Still Undecided
description: The authorities are determining who will take custody of Maria, 13, whose single father has been sentenced for “discrediting” the Russian Army.

title: In Dealing With China, U.S. and Europe Take Different Tacks
description: The Biden administration says there is “convergence.” But trans-Atlantic leaders adopt different strategies on security and trade issues — including on Ukraine and Taiwan.

title: ‘Chilling Effect’: Arrest of Journalist Has Made Covering Russia Even Tougher
description: The detention of the Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich poses new obstacles for Western journalists seeking to report on Vladimir V. Putin’s rule.

title: E.P.A Lab Helps Plan the Fastest Road to an EV Future
description: Government scientists have spent a year analyzing electric vehicles to help the E.P.A. design new tailpipe rules to trigger an electric car revolution.

title: Pope Will Miss Good Friday Procession Because of Cold Weather
description: Francis was released from the hospital only last Saturday after a bout with bronchitis.

title: Chinese ‘Chained Woman’ Jail Sentences Revive Online Outrage
description: The episode stirred anger not only for its shock factor, but also for the wider social problems it exemplified, and the government’s lack of transparency.

title: U.A.E. Denies Extradition for Gupta Brothers, Accused of Corruption in South Africa
description: The businessmen Atul and Rajesh Gupta were implicated in the looting of state funds under President Jacob Zuma. They fled to the United Arab Emirates about five years ago.

title: Keir Starmer Is Quietly Bending the U.K. Labour Party to His Will
description: Political observers from his own side say he has been “ruthless” in reshaping the party as it looks to reclaim power.

title: China and France Call for ‘All Efforts to Restore Peace in Ukraine’
description: The statement was issued after a three-day summit by Xi Jinping and Emmanuel Macron in China.

title: A Cobra Appeared Mid-Flight. The Pilot’s Quick Thinking Saved Lives.
description: The pilot made an emergency landing after feeling a Cape Cobra slither under his shirt while flying across South Africa. “I had a moment of stunned silence,” he said.

title: Israel Strikes Back at Lebanon After Rocket Barrage
description: Tensions along the border between the two countries have escalated to the highest level in years. On Friday, a shooting attack in the occupied West Bank killed two Israelis.

title: Ukraine Maintains That Its War Plans Are Secret
description: As the Pentagon said it was investigating a leak of classified U.S. and NATO plans to aid Ukraine’s military, an adviser to President Volodymyr Zelensky said the disclosures contained “fictitious information.” Here is what we’re covering:

title: The Response to Crime
description: Republican lawmakers are putting limits on progressive prosecutors.

title: Five Men Killed and Fears Over a Military’s Growing Power
description: Uniformed soldiers shot unarmed civilians then blocked medics from providing care, a top government official said. To many Mexicans, such abuse is all too familiar.

title: Nord Stream Whodunit Deepens as Shreds of Evidence Emerge
description: Intelligence leaks surrounding the sabotage of the pipelines have provided more questions than answers. It may be in no one’s interest to reveal more.

title: U.K. Seafood Exports Race Against the Tides of Brexit
description: British seafood is prized in France and Spain far more than at home. Britain’s exit from the European Union hasn’t halted exports, but the path from sea to stovetop is fraught with new obstacles.

title: ‘Joyland,’ an L.G.B.T. Pakistani Film, Is Celebrated Abroad
description: Saim Sadiq’s feature “Joyland,” which includes a transgender woman’s love affair, cannot be shown in Pakistan’s Punjab Province.

title: How AI and DNA Are Unlocking the Mysteries of Global Supply Chains
description: Firms are turning to advanced technologies to help answer a surprisingly tricky question: Where do products really come from?

title: Dmitry Krymov, Exiled Russian Director, Starts Over in New York
description: Dmitry Krymov, one of Russia’s most eminent directors, is among the dozens of artists who have left their homeland since Russia invaded Ukraine.

title: Who Jacinda Ardern Really Is
description: As told in her first and farewell speeches.

title: Baptist Minister in Myanmar Gets 6 Years in Prison for Opposing Junta
description: The minister met with President Donald J. Trump in 2019 to highlight the abuses of Myanmar’s military, which later seized power in a coup.

title: As the war grinds on in Ukraine, Ireland will examine its military neutrality.
Your Friday Briefing
description: A war documents leak.

title: Israel Strikes Lebanon After Rocket Attack From Militias
description: The Israeli military blamed Palestinian exiles in Lebanon for what appeared to be a retaliatory attack over Israel’s raid of a mosque at a Jerusalem holy site two days earlier.
